definition: to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: The Heuristic will be similar to CIMA and on similar lines to Kaspersky and Avira.
sentences.chinese: 启发式将类似于西玛和类似的行卡巴斯基和查杀。

sentences.english: Searching the text-searchable parts you are interested in does not require an heuristic approach.
sentences.chinese: 搜索您感兴趣的可搜索部分不需要启发式方法。
图1启发式地说明了我们的技术。

sentences.english: There can be no simple heuristic for determining service granularity. Rather, we offer two examples of factors that you should consider when designing services
sentences.chinese: 没有可用于确定服务粒度的简单启发式方法。

sentences.english: This article reviews the applications of heuristic didactics to pharmacology teaching.
sentences.chinese: 对启发式教学法在药理学教学中的应用进行了论述。

sentences.english: The Theory transcends and brings heuristic education to a great height of development.
sentences.chinese: 诱思探究学科教学论是启发式教学的宏扬与超越。

sentences.english: Design the optimal cruise trajectory of the Attack UAV in the horizontal plane using heuristic search algorithm.
sentences.chinese: 运用启发式搜索算法对巡航段进行优化设计。

sentences.english: Still widely used is the Espresso heuristic logic minimizer and Magic.
sentences.chinese: 仍然广泛使用的是咖啡的启发式逻辑极小和魔术队。

sentences.english: Ask customers to do heuristic UI reviews.
sentences.chinese: 要求客户进行启发式的界面复审。

sentences.english: And now, this is limbic learning and it works. This is really simple.
sentences.chinese: 这是启发式学习而且起作用了，这真的很简单。

sentences.english: The model was resolved with heuristic algorithm based on Tabu search technique.
sentences.chinese: 利用禁忌搜索技术设计启发式算法对模型求解。

definition: Bayes (name)/Thomas Bayes (1702-1761), English mathematician and theologian
(idiom) to teach in line with the student's ability
